words.meaning: vt. 修理 n. (U)修理，修补
亲自地，本人地；就个人而言
比赛；竞赛；对手；火柴t. 与……匹配
安全的；平安的 n. (C)保险柜
v话. 抵达；到达 n. (C)伸手可及的范围
工程；课程；作业；项目；规划 vt. 投
陆地；土地 v. 降落；登陆

words.example: Curiosity drives people to explore the unknown.

words.meaning: (C/U)惊奇 nt. 使惊奇，使诧异
vi. 获得成功，达到目的

words.example: He is aware of the risks of using AI too much.
There are hundreds of cattle grazing on the farm.
She bought a dozen eggs from the supermarket.
The vet checked the dog carefully.
Spaghetti is often served with tomato sauce.
Bread is usually made from wheat.
She added some chilli to make the dish spicy.
Shrimp is commonly used in seafood dishes.
The thunderstorm caused a power cut last night.
A sandstorm hit the desert area suddenly.
The explorers entered a dark cave.
Water began to pour from the broken pipe.

words.meaning: 航空航天工业；航空航天领域
words.example: She works in the aerospace industry.
The device can detect smoke quickly.
They ordered Chinese takeout for dinner.

phrases.example: You should be aware of the risks before making a decision.
The bicycles are repaired for the people in the area.
She usually takes a walk after supper.
He likes reading in his spare time.
She bought half a dozen eggs.
I need a pound of butter.
He likes his coffee with cream.

phrases.meaning: 什么都不加；不带任何东西
phrases.example: He likes his coffee without anything.

phrases.meaning: 参加聚会（较正式或明确安排的活动）
phrases.example: She didn’t attend the party last night.
He went to a lecture on space science.
I couldn’t go out because I had a bad cold.
The noodles are so thin that you can see through them.
The noodles are boiled in water before serving.
They decided to make camp near the river.
He took out his phone to take a photo.
They arrived at the station just in time.
The island can only be reached by boat.
Blood was pouring from a cut on his head.
The telephone was invented by Bell.
Driven by curiosity, he explored the unknown area.
The spacecraft made a successful soft landing on the moon.
It turned out that the story was true.
What do you use the Internet for?
Watch for cars when you cross the street.
The child learned to dress by himself.

patterns.phrase: It takes sb. time to do sth.
patterns.meaning: 花某人多长时间做某事
patterns.pattern: it takes sb. time to do sth.

patterns.meaning: 结果发现 事实证明
patterns.example: It turned out that he was telling the truth.
It turned out to be much more difficult than we expected.

grammar.title: 情态动词
grammar.definition: 表示说话人的语气或态度的动词，后接动词原形，没有人称和数的变化。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 情态动词 + 动词原形
usage: can/could 表能力、许可、可能：I can swim. / Could you help me?
may/might 表许可、可能：May I come in? / It may rain.
must 表必须、肯定推测：You must finish it. / He must be at home.
should 表应该、建议：You should study hard.
need 表需要（否定needn't）：You needn't worry.

mistakes.wrong: He can swims.
mistakes.explanation: 情态动词后接动词原形，不加-s

mistakes.wrong: Must I finish it? — No, you mustn't.
mistakes.correct: Must I finish it? — No, you needn't/don't have to.
mistakes.explanation: must的否定回答用needn't或don't have to，mustn't表禁止

mistakes.wrong: He must be not at home.
mistakes.explanation: must be的否定是can't be，不是must not be

examples: Can you speak Japanese?
You must hand in your homework on time.
You should be more careful.

grammar.title: 定语从句
grammar.definition: 在复合句中修饰名词或代词的从句，通常紧跟在被修饰的词（先行词）之后。
grammar.structure: 先行词 + 关系词(who/which/that/whose/where/when) + 从句
usage: who/that指人：The man who/that is talking is my father.
which/that指物：The book which/that I bought is interesting.
whose表所属：The girl whose mother is a doctor is my friend.
where指地点：This is the school where I studied.
when指时间：I still remember the day when I met you.

mistakes.wrong: The man which is talking is my teacher.
mistakes.correct: The man who/that is talking is my teacher.
mistakes.explanation: 先行词是人时，用who或that，不用which

mistakes.wrong: The book who I bought is good.
mistakes.correct: The book which/that I bought is good.
mistakes.explanation: 先行词是物时，用which或that，不用who

mistakes.wrong: This is the place where I visited.
mistakes.correct: This is the place which/that I visited.
mistakes.explanation: visit是及物动词，需要宾语，用which/that而非where

examples: I have a friend who can speak five languages.
The movie that we saw last night was exciting.
I'll never forget the day when I graduated.

sub_topics.title: 定语从句（that引导）
sub_topics.definition: that引导从句修饰名词
usage: that作主语或宾语
examples: The book that I like is interesting.

sub_topics.title: 名词 + 定语从句
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: 定语从句（后置定语）
sub_topics.definition: 修饰名词的从句，通常放在名词后
sub_topics.structure: 名词 + 关系词 + 从句
usage: that / who / which 等
examples: The boy who is reading is my brother.

grammar.title: 形容词/副词比较级
grammar.definition: 用于两者之间的比较，表示'更...'的意思。
grammar.structure: 形容词/副词比较级 + than / more + 形容词/副词原级 + than
usage: 单音节和部分双音节词：加-er（tall→taller, big→bigger）
多音节和部分双音节词：more + 原级（beautiful→more beautiful）
不规则变化：good/well→better, bad/badly→worse, many/much→more
比较级的修饰词：much, a lot, even, still, a little

mistakes.wrong: She is more taller than me.
mistakes.explanation: tall是单音节词，用-er形式，不需要more

mistakes.wrong: He runs more fast than me.
mistakes.explanation: fast的比较级是faster，不是more fast

mistakes.wrong: This book is more better.
mistakes.correct: This book is better / much better.
mistakes.explanation: good的比较级是better，不能用more修饰

examples: My sister is two years older than me.
This question is more difficult than that one.
He works much harder than before.

sub_topics.title: 比较级递增结构（more and more）
sub_topics.definition: 表示程度不断加深，意为“越来越……”。
sub_topics.structure: more and more + 形容词/副词
usage: 描述变化趋势
常用于抽象概念
examples: The weather is getting more and more cold.
English is becoming more and more important.

sub_topics.title: 比较级用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示两者之间的比较
sub_topics.structure: 形容词/副词比较级 + than
usage: 比较两个人或事物
强调程度变化
examples: This book is more interesting than that one.

grammar.title: 现在分词 (v. -ing作形容词/副词)
grammar.definition: 由动词-ing形式构成，可以作定语、状语、表语和宾语补足语，表示主动或正在进行。
usage: 作定语（表主动/进行）：the sleeping baby = the baby who is sleeping
作状语：Hearing the news, she jumped with joy.
作表语：The movie is exciting.
作宾语补足语：I saw him running.

mistakes.wrong: The news is excited.
mistakes.explanation: 修饰物用-ing（令人...的），修饰人用-ed（感到...的）

mistakes.wrong: Seen from the hill, we can see the whole city.
mistakes.correct: Seeing from the hill, we can see the whole city.
mistakes.explanation: 分词的逻辑主语要与句子主语一致

examples: Look at the running water.
The story is very interesting.
Walking along the street, I met an old friend.

grammar.title: 一般过去时
grammar.definition: 表示过去某一时间发生的动作或存在的状态，也表示过去经常或反复发生的动作。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 动词过去式（be动词用was/were）
usage: 表示过去发生的动作：I visited my grandma yesterday.
表示过去存在的状态：He was a teacher ten years ago.
表示过去的习惯：When I was young, I often played football.

mistakes.wrong: I go to Beijing last year.
mistakes.correct: I went to Beijing last year.
mistakes.explanation: 有过去时间标志词（last year），动词要用过去式

mistakes.wrong: Did you went there?
mistakes.explanation: did后面的动词要用原形

examples: She bought a new dress yesterday.
They were happy at the party.
I didn't watch TV last night.

sub_topics.title: 一般过去时的用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生的动作
usage: 与过去时间状语连用
examples: I went to school yesterday.

grammar.title: 现在完成时
grammar.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在造成的影响或结果，也表示从过去持续到现在的动作或状态。
grammar.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 表示过去的动作对现在的影响：I have lost my key. (现在没有钥匙)
表示经历：Have you ever been to Beijing?
表示持续到现在的状态：I have lived here for 10 years.
常与already, yet, just, ever, never, for, since连用

mistakes.wrong: I have see the movie.
mistakes.explanation: have/has后面要用动词的过去分词形式

mistakes.wrong: I have bought this book yesterday.
mistakes.explanation: 有具体过去时间（yesterday），不能用现在完成时

mistakes.wrong: He has gone to Beijing for 3 days.
mistakes.correct: He has been in Beijing for 3 days.
mistakes.explanation: have gone表示去了还没回来，不能与for连用

examples: She has already finished her homework.
I have never met him before.
We have known each other since 2020.

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时的基本结构
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生并对现在有影响
usage: 强调结果或经验
examples: I have been to Beijing.

sub_topics.title: have/has + 过去分词
sub_topics.definition: 构成现在完成时。
usage: 表示完成或经验
examples: I have finished my homework.

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时结构
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生并影响现在的动作
usage: 经验
结果
持续
examples: I have been to Beijing.

sub_topics.title: have + 过去分词
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时结构（have/has + 过去分词）
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在有影响
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 强调结果或经历
常与 already, ever 连用
examples: I have finished my work.

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时的用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在产生影响
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 表示已完成的动作
表示经验或结果
examples: I have finished my work.

grammar.title: 被动语态
grammar.definition: 当主语是动作的承受者时，使用被动语态。强调动作的承受者或动作本身。
grammar.structure: 主语 + be + 过去分词 + (by + 动作执行者)
usage: 不知道或不必说明动作执行者：The window was broken.
强调动作承受者：The book was written by Lu Xun.
客观报道或正式场合：The meeting will be held tomorrow.
各种时态的被动：is done, was done, will be done, has been done等

mistakes.wrong: The car was repair yesterday.
mistakes.explanation: be后面要用动词的过去分词

mistakes.wrong: The book is belonged to me.
mistakes.explanation: belong是不及物动词，没有被动语态

examples: English is spoken all over the world.
The bridge was built in 1990.
The work must be finished on time.

sub_topics.title: 被动语态的基本结构
sub_topics.definition: 强调动作承受者
usage: 不知道或不强调动作执行者
examples: The room is cleaned every day.

sub_topics.title: be + 过去分词
sub_topics.definition: 构成被动语态。
usage: 强调承受动作
examples: The door is closed.

sub_topics.title: 被动语态结构
sub_topics.definition: 强调动作承受者
usage: 不知道或不强调执行者
examples: The house is built.

sub_topics.title: will + be + 过去分词
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

sub_topics.title: 被动语态结构（be + 过去分词）
sub_topics.definition: 表示主语是动作的承受者
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + be + 过去分词 (+ by...)
usage: 不知道或不强调动作执行者
强调结果
examples: The window is broken.

sub_topics.title: 被动语态的用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示动作的承受者是主语
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + be + 过去分词
usage: 强调动作的承受者
不知道或不强调动作执行者
examples: The window is broken.

grammar.title: 状语从句
grammar.definition: 在复合句中作状语的从句，用来修饰主句，表示时间、条件、原因、目的、结果、让步等。
grammar.structure: 连词 + 从句，主句（从句可前可后）
usage: 时间状语从句：when, while, before, after, as soon as, until等
条件状语从句：if, unless (= if not)
原因状语从句：because, since, as
让步状语从句：although/though, even if/though
结果状语从句：so...that..., such...that...

mistakes.wrong: If it will rain tomorrow, I will stay at home.
mistakes.correct: If it rains tomorrow, I will stay at home.
mistakes.explanation: 在条件状语从句中，用一般现在时表将来

mistakes.wrong: Although he is tired, but he keeps working.
mistakes.correct: Although he is tired, he keeps working.
mistakes.explanation: although和but不能同时使用

mistakes.wrong: Because I was ill, so I didn't go to school.
mistakes.correct: Because I was ill, I didn't go to school.
mistakes.explanation: because和so不能同时使用

examples: I will call you as soon as I arrive.
Unless you work hard, you won't succeed.
He was so tired that he fell asleep immediately.

sub_topics.title: when + 从句
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: how to + 动词原形
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

grammar.title: 非谓语
grammar.definition: 非谓语

sub_topics.title: 过去分词作形容词
sub_topics.definition: 过去分词表示被动或完成状态
usage: 修饰名词
强调状态
examples: The broken window was fixed.

sub_topics.title: 不定式作宾语
sub_topics.definition: to do在句中作宾语
usage: 常见于ask, want, hope等动词后
examples: She wants to learn English.

sub_topics.title: 过去分词的三种用法（完成时、被动语态、形容词）
不定式作目的状语
sub_topics.definition: 用to do表示目的
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + 动词 + to do
usage: 表示“为了……”
examples: He studies hard to pass the exam.

sub_topics.title: to do与doing的区别
sub_topics.definition: to do常表示目的或将来，doing常表示已发生或习惯。
usage: 根据动词固定搭配决定
examples: I decided to go.
I enjoy reading.

sub_topics.title: 动词原形与to do的区别
sub_topics.definition: 原形用于助动词后，to do用于不定式结构。
usage: 区分句法功能
examples: You must go.
I want to go.

sub_topics.title: v-ing 作主语
sub_topics.definition: 动名词短语作主语，表示一件事。
usage: 描述行为或活动
examples: Reading books makes me happy.

grammar.title: 连词
grammar.definition: 连词

sub_topics.title: 连词and连接并列句
sub_topics.definition: and用于连接并列成分或句子
usage: 表示顺承或并列
examples: I like English and I study it every day.

sub_topics.title: 并列连词and合并句子
sub_topics.definition: 用and连接同一主语或相关句子
usage: 避免重复主语
examples: He stood up and left the room.

sub_topics.title: 连接词and的用法
sub_topics.definition: and用于连接并列的词、短语或句子。
usage: 连接并列成分
表示顺承关系
examples: I like apples and oranges.
He stood up and left.

sub_topics.title: 并列连词and的用法
sub_topics.definition: 用于连接并列的词、短语或句子
usage: 连接两个并列成分
连接两个并列句
examples: I like apples and oranges.
He opened the door and went out.

sub_topics.title: 连接词的使用
sub_topics.definition: 连接词用于连接单词、短语或句子，使句子结构更完整、逻辑更清晰。
sub_topics.structure: 连词 + 单词 / 短语 / 句子
usage: 并列连词连接并列成分，如 and, but, or
从属连词引导从句，如 because, when, if, that
连接词后面可以接完整句子
避免句子之间缺少连接词导致结构错误
examples: I like English and math.
He stayed at home because it was raining.
She knows that he is right.

grammar.title: 动名词 (v. -ing作名词)
grammar.definition: 由动词-ing形式构成，具有名词性质，可以作主语、宾语、表语等。
usage: 作主语：Swimming is good for health.
作宾语：I enjoy reading books. / Thank you for helping me.
作表语：My hobby is collecting stamps.
某些动词后只能接动名词：enjoy, finish, mind, practice, avoid, consider等

mistakes.wrong: I enjoy to swim.
mistakes.explanation: enjoy后只能接动名词，不能接不定式

mistakes.wrong: Thank you for help me.
mistakes.explanation: 介词后要用动名词

examples: Reading makes a full man.
Would you mind opening the window?
She is good at playing the piano.

sub_topics.title: 动名词作宾语
sub_topics.definition: 某些动词后接动名词
usage: 表示习惯或喜好
examples: He enjoys reading.

sub_topics.title: 动名词作主语 + 动词第三人称单数
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: 动词-ing与动词原形作宾补的区别
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

sub_topics.title: 动名词作主语 + 谓语
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

sub_topics.title: 动名词作主语（reading books makes...）
sub_topics.definition: 动词-ing 形式作主语，视为单数
sub_topics.structure: 动名词短语 + 谓语（三单）
usage: 表示一件事
examples: Reading books makes people wiser.

grammar.title: 特殊疑问句
grammar.definition: 用特殊疑问词（what, who, where, when, why, how等）提问的句子，不能用yes或no回答。
grammar.structure: 特殊疑问词 + 一般疑问句语序（疑问词作主语时除外）
usage: what问什么：What is your name?
who问谁：Who is that man? / Who(m) did you see?
where问地点：Where do you live?
when问时间：When did you arrive?
why问原因：Why are you late?
how问方式/程度：How do you go to school? / How old are you?

mistakes.wrong: What you want?
mistakes.explanation: 特殊疑问句需要助动词（疑问词作主语时除外）

mistakes.wrong: Who did break the window?
mistakes.explanation: who作主语时，不需要助动词did

mistakes.wrong: How many book do you have?
mistakes.correct: How many books do you have?
mistakes.explanation: how many后面要用可数名词复数

examples: What time does the movie start?
Who teaches you English?
How often do you exercise?

sub_topics.title: 对划线部分提问的方法
sub_topics.definition: 将划线部分换成疑问词
sub_topics.structure: 疑问词 + 一般疑问句
usage: 注意时态
examples: He lives in Beijing. → Where does he live?

sub_topics.title: 特殊疑问句语序
sub_topics.definition: 特殊疑问句中疑问词置于句首。
sub_topics.structure: 疑问词 + 一般疑问句语序
usage: 对信息提问
examples: Where do you live?
What did he say?

sub_topics.title: 特殊疑问句（宾语提问）
sub_topics.definition: 对宾语提问时用what/whom等。
sub_topics.structure: 疑问词 + 一般疑问句语序
usage: 提问动作对象
examples: What did you buy?

sub_topics.title: wh-疑问词 + 一般疑问句语序
sub_topics.definition: 使某人变得……

sub_topics.title: what + 一般疑问句语序
sub_topics.definition: 使某人变得……

sub_topics.title: 特殊疑问句的构成
sub_topics.definition: 对句子成分提问
sub_topics.structure: 特殊疑问词 + 一般疑问句
usage: 提问时间地点原因等
examples: Where do you live?

sub_topics.title: wh-词 + 一般疑问句
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: what + 助动词 + 主语 + 动词原形
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: 特殊疑问句结构（WH-词提问）
sub_topics.definition: 使用疑问词对句子成分提问
usage: what, who, where, why 等
examples: Where do you live?

sub_topics.title: what + 名词 + 一般疑问句
对划线部分提问的步骤
sub_topics.definition: 将陈述句中被划线的部分转换为相应的特殊疑问句，用来询问该信息。
sub_topics.structure: 疑问词 + 一般疑问句语序
usage: 第一步：判断划线部分的含义（人、物、时间、地点、原因、方式等）
第二步：选择合适的疑问词（who, what, when, where, why, how 等）
第三步：将疑问词放在句首
第四步：剩余部分改为一般疑问句语序（有be/情态动词直接提前，没有则用do does did）
第五步：注意时态、人称和动词形式的变化
examples: He teaches people how to build houses. → What does he teach people?
They spend the summer in the mountains. → Where do they spend the summer?
Alice volunteers in summer. → When does Alice volunteer?

grammar.title: 主谓一致
grammar.definition: 句子的主语和谓语动词在人称和数上要保持一致。
grammar.structure: 单数主语 + 单数谓语 / 复数主语 + 复数谓语
usage: 就近原则：There is/are..., Either...or..., Neither...nor..., Not only...but also...
就远原则：主语 + with/as well as/together with/except/besides + 名词
不可数名词作主语，谓语用单数：Water is important.
动名词/不定式作主语，谓语用单数：Swimming is good for health.
集体名词：family, class, team等看作整体用单数，看作成员用复数

mistakes.wrong: The teacher with his students are in the classroom.
mistakes.correct: The teacher with his students is in the classroom.
mistakes.explanation: with引导的部分不是主语，主语是teacher，谓语用单数

mistakes.wrong: Neither you nor he are right.
mistakes.correct: Neither you nor he is right.
mistakes.explanation: neither...nor...就近原则，he是单数，用is

mistakes.wrong: Maths are my favorite subject.
mistakes.explanation: 学科名词（maths, physics, news等）虽以s结尾，但作单数

examples: Everyone is here.
Not only he but also I am a student.
The police are looking for the thief.

sub_topics.title: 主语与谓语一致
sub_topics.definition: 谓语动词与主语在人称和数上保持一致
sub_topics.structure: 单数主语 + 单数谓语
usage: 动名词作主语视为单数
examples: Reading books makes people wiser.

sub_topics.title: 主谓一致（第三人称单数）
sub_topics.definition: 当主语为第三人称单数时，谓语动词需使用第三人称单数形式
sub_topics.structure: 主语（第三人称单数） + 动词三单形式
usage: 主语是 he / she / it
主语是单数名词
动名词或不定式作主语视为单数
examples: He likes milk.
Reading books makes people smarter.

grammar.title: 代词 (人称/物主/反身/指示)
grammar.definition: 用来代替名词或名词短语的词，包括人称代词、物主代词、反身代词、指示代词等。
grammar.structure: 根据在句中的成分选择相应形式
usage: 人称代词主格（作主语）：I, you, he, she, it, we, they
人称代词宾格（作宾语）：me, you, him, her, it, us, them
形容词性物主代词（后接名词）：my, your, his, her, its, our, their
名词性物主代词（独立使用）：mine, yours, his, hers, its, ours, theirs
反身代词：myself, yourself, himself, herself, itself, ourselves, themselves

mistakes.wrong: Me and Tom are friends.
mistakes.explanation: 作主语用主格I，且把自己放后面

mistakes.wrong: This is her, not my.
mistakes.explanation: 独立使用时用名词性物主代词

mistakes.wrong: He hurt hisself.
mistakes.explanation: 反身代词是himself，不是hisself

examples: She gave me a book.
This is my book. That is yours.
He taught himself English.

sub_topics.title: pronoun
sub_topics.definition: 代词，用来代替名词或名词短语，避免重复，使句子更简洁

grammar.title: 正式场合与非正式场合中表示“参加”的动词区别
grammar.definition: 英语中“参加”根据场合正式程度不同，使用的动词也不同。
grammar.structure: attend + 活动 / 会议；go to + 活动；take part in + 活动
usage: attend 常用于正式、严肃的场合，如会议、讲座、仪式
go to 多用于一般性、日常活动，如聚会、派对
take part in 强调参与过程，多用于活动、比赛、娱乐性事件
examples: He attended an important meeting.
She didn’t go to the party.
Many students took part in the sports meeting.

grammar.title: how long 与 since / for 的区分
grammar.definition: how long 用于提问时间长度，since 和 for 用于回答时间，常与现在完成时连用。
grammar.structure: How long have/has sb. done sth.?；since + 时间点；for + 时间段
usage: how long 询问动作持续了多久
since 后接具体时间点，如 since 2022, since morning
for 后接一段时间，如 for two years, for a long time
examples: How long have you lived here?
I have lived here since 2020.
I have lived here for five years.

grammar.title: 否定词与否定形容词的替换（no / little）
grammar.definition: 英语中 no 和 little 都可表示否定意义，但词性和用法不同。
grammar.structure: no + 名词；little + 不可数名词
usage: no 是否定形容词，直接修饰名词
little 表示“几乎没有”，语气比 no 稍弱
not 不能直接修饰名词，需借助助动词
examples: He has no hope of winning.
He has little hope of winning.
There is little time left.

grammar.title: 固定搭配 have been aware of
grammar.definition: have been aware of 表示“已经意识到……”，常用于现在完成时。
grammar.structure: have/has been aware of + 名词 / 动名词
usage: 强调从过去到现在已经意识到某事
aware 后必须接介词 of
不能与 have been to 混用
examples: More people have been aware of the problem.
She has been aware of the importance of health.

grammar.title: 常用复数
grammar.definition: (pl.) 筷子（常用复数）

grammar.title: 常与现在完成时连用
grammar.definition: 从早上开始（常与现在完成时连用）
